column4: shouldn't admit this, but running Ubuntu is the 1st time in 5yrs I've had a legal OS on my PC... :)
heh, 5 years only?
well, before that I didn't own my own comp, so just 5yrs, ya...
ehe :)
is ubuntu your first linux distro install?
yes, 98 & XP before last week. total linux noob here...
cool, welcome
it's mostly fun. really like the sound/vid apps that U installs w/
but I really, really miss Photoshop... :(
whatever works for you, just relaying my experience
gimp can do all but a few things ps can
i had to sit down and work on a commercial project for about 2 day to unlearn ps
need to get used to the GIMP, that's all. was pretty good w/ PS, need to spend a weekend w/ the GIMP..
just keep in mind that you litterally haveto deprogram from it, you will love what it can do :)
deprogramming from PS? the Cult of Adobe lives! :)
when you combine gnome, multiple desktops, and the fact that gimp is not constrained by mdi ...
know what u mean tho, i keep trying PS keybrd shortcuts in the GIMP and then swearing...
yes that got me too
i actually made a mistake by trying the ps shortcuts for imp (they are there you just haveto turn them on)
i found that the problem with ps like gimp is that you only get like 50% of the way there to ps, but its still not ps
does stock GIMP have PS shortcuts included somewhere?
so it ended up feeling like a retarded step child, instead i just decided to learn gimp shortcuts
yes, google it
yeah, 'going native' is probably the best way to go.
will google for the PS shortcuts. thnx for the tip.
great point, actually.
better robot story here: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/somerset/4077698.stm  :)
ha!  that is much better than my robot story
no, Canadian, actually. A friend sent me that URL, and I use the BBC website a lot anyway!
you need one of the jumping cats pics instead i think
wow, that's a lot of flash. is there a point to it?
you do/did web design?
exactly my problem - I keep hitting the PS keys in GIMP...
right i have greater than 10 years of ps
i haveto admit, that i absolutely HAVETO have the zoom and wand shortcuts like ps
I thought it was odd that gimp doesn't even have the zoom mapped to a key by default...
*nod*
it does?
yup. openclipart.org is suddenly a lot easier to browse!
ubuntu packages for so many *nix branches - but the Ubuntu one came in quickly!
i noticed that, very cool indeed
beat me to the next part! ;)
indeedy, i can view svg!
weird, are you on the west coast?
yeah. BC
where in BC?
yup - even worse: Burgundavia is my younger brother...
already did that, it's a great app!
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/CategoryGames
even
np ;)
what *are* you doing? 300 tabs?
browsing a folder quickly, you open up a bunch of links in tabs and cycle through with ctrl/w ... i just wanted to see how epiphany handles a large load, ff dies at about 40 or 50
what sort of extension?
play through bookmarks, with forward, back, pause, play icons.  perhaps some sort of setting to check off which folders you want to play through
interesting - I'd have to see a demo before I really grokked that idea, I think (besides, I use Opera myself...)
I think you have to use a chainsaw on zombies... that's what Hollywood says, anyway! ;)
thanks, bookmarked!
who says?
kasperky ... lemme get a link, it was a real bs article
can't get it, can't ping either - .com and .ca
running an Apache/PHP/MySQL stack is easy enough on an Ubuntu machine, if you want to watch PHP in action
of course, i'm testing out the wysiwyg functionality of quanta
a non answer might be to suggest using gnome baker ... not sure if kde gives you that granular control over apps
gnomebaker only burns coasters for me :|
it's not...
but it's Gnome users who're the idiots, Torvalds said so! :P
i'm taking away your stir stick
perhaps its time to start thinking about a section on the wiki called its a good thing *tm* / its a bad thing *tm*
the trouble is, the wiki is already full of good advice, and not enough people read it... :P
thats a pretty darned good point ... if everyone read the wiki this channel would be fairly quiet
perhaps we need a big icon in the default login setup that is labeledsomething like "HOW TO USE UBUNTU" an dpoitns to wiki or something
the basic documentation for Dapper is going to be a lot better (doc.ubuntu.com if you want a preview)
*ooh* you guys are working on that? nice
I happen to be, I'm on the Ubuntu DocTeam as well as loitering here far too much :P
sweet, you've always given lots of great advice to the peeps
is that run as a wiki or?
it's not a wiki, but if you've got suggestions, you could join the DocTeam mailing list
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DocumentationTeam/Contact
cool it, all right?
#ubuntu-offtopic - and post the URL ;)
cool it, OK?
since when does Sony qualify as nice? "Accept the rootkit and shut up already" Sony? :P
hehe :) i know your screwed either way
my only hope is that the ps3 has a linux os and somehow that spurrs some development for tools on this platform
language, thanks
the s word got through :)
redcard & others - please take the non-tech-support chat to #ubuntu-offtopic, thanks
#ubuntu-offtopic is thataway to chat about Johnny Mnemonic, please
lol indeed :)
go away, i'm not really interested in what you haveto say
& adrift - #ubuntu-offtopic or PM for non-support discussion, pls
understanding the why sometimes helps explain the how.  try to be a little flexible
